meanings.definition: Deprived of inheritance or succession rights.
meanings.sent1: The poor orphan felt sad being disinherited from his family's wealth.
meanings.sent2: The siblings were upset when they found out they were disinherited from their grandfather's will.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked at the empty food bowl as if it had been disinherited of its treats.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house seemed to be disinherited by time, with vines creeping up its walls.
meanings.sent5: The wilted flower appeared to be disinherited of sunlight, drooping in the shade.

meanings.sent1: The distant relative felt left out and disinherited from the family fortune.
meanings.sent2: The youngest son was disinherited and left with nothing but memories of his ancestors.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten toy in the attic seemed to be disinherited from playtime.
meanings.sent4: The old book on the shelf looked dusty and disinherited, untouched for years.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned building stood alone, disinherited from the bustling city life.

meanings.definition: To cut off from inheritance or succession.
meanings.sent1: The king decided to disinherited his rebellious son from the throne.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer explained how the will disinherited the greedy nephew from the family fortune.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seemed to disinherited the birds from their feeder.
meanings.sent4: The storm threatened to disinherited the fragile bridge from the mainland.
meanings.sent5: The strict teacher's rules seemed to disinherited any fun from the classroom.
